intro: Corydalis pallidiflora, commonly known as the pale-flowered larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and delicate, spurred flowers. The flowers are typically pale pink to white, with two prominent lobes that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
